title: On the Salient Limits of Strings of Assembly Theory
content: We consider the formation of strings of any natural radix b within the framework of assembly theory. In particular, we show that the upper bound of the assembly index depends on the radix b both quantitatively and qualitatively, and the longest length N of a string that has the assembly index of N-k is given by N(N-k)=b2+b+3k-2 for k={1,2,3}. We also provide two particular forms of such strings. For k=1 such odd length strings are nearly balanced and there are four such different strings if b=2 and seventy-two if b=3. Since these results are valid also for b=1, assembly theory subsumes information theory.
